analysis: The documents are all presidential orders that authorize the inspection of tax returns by various government entities, including congressional committees, the Department of Commerce, and the Office of Price Administration. The reasons for inspection vary, including investigations into munitions, government efficiency, juvenile delinquency, un-American activities, and crime. The orders cite specific sections of the Internal Revenue Code and other revenue acts as the basis for the authorization.
title: Tax Return Inspections for Governmental Oversight
